SUNDAY SCHOOL TIP

Start your lesson with a question that makes kids THINK!

Instead of: Today we're learning about David and Goliath
Try: Have you ever faced something that seemed impossible?

Watch their eyes light up!

What's your favorite way to start a lesson?

YOU ARE MAKING AN ETERNAL DIFFERENCE.

That wiggly 5-year-old? They're learning that church is a safe place.
That distracted teen? They're hearing truth that will guide them for life.

Keep going. Keep teaching. Keep loving.

You are seen. You are valued. You matter.

SUNDAY SCHOOL TIP

The 5-minute rule: If a child can't sit still for 5 minutes, they need a MOVEMENT BREAK!

Quick ideas:
- Stand up if you've ever...
- Action song
- Act out part of the story
- High-five your neighbor

What's your go-to movement break?

#TeachingTips #SundaySchool #ChildrensMinistry

SUNDAY SCHOOL TIP

VISUAL LEARNERS need to SEE it.
AUDITORY LEARNERS need to HEAR it.
KINESTHETIC LEARNERS need to DO it.

Your class has ALL THREE.

That's why great lessons include:
- Reading/showing the story
- Discussing/explaining
- Activities/crafts/movement

Mix it up and watch engagement soar!

#TeachingTips #LearningStyles #SundaySchool

FREE RESOURCE FRIDAY!

5 Quick Games for Bible Memory Verses:

1. SWORD DRILL - First to find the verse wins!
2. WORD SCRAMBLE - Mix up the words, put them in order
3. FILL THE BLANK - Leave out key words
4. HOT POTATO - Pass an object, whoever holds it recites
5. ACTIONS - Create motions for each phrase

Save this post!

#MemoryVerse #BibleGames #SundaySchoolIdeas

Teacher, before you step into class today...

Take a breath.
Say a prayer.
Remember: You're not alone in that room.

The same God who parted seas and moved mountains is with YOU today.

Go change some lives!

#SundayMorning #TeacherPrayer #ChildrensMinistry

SUNDAY SCHOOL TIP

The power of NAMES:

"Great job, class!" = okay
"Great job, EMMA!" = magical

Use kids' names as often as possible. They feel:
- Seen
- Known
- Important

It changes EVERYTHING.

#TeachingTips #SundaySchool #ChildrensMinistry

SUNDAY SCHOOL TEACHER CHECKLIST:

- Arrive early (or sprint in at the last second)
- Remember everyone's name (or get creative: "Hey buddy!")
- Keep kids engaged (interpretive dance counts, right?)
- Not lose any children (the ultimate goal)
- Share God's love (always)

How's your checklist looking?

Happy Sunday!

Whether you have 3 kids or 30...
Whether they listened perfectly or climbed the walls...
Whether you felt prepared or winged it...

You showed up.
You shared Jesus.
That matters more than you know.

Well done, good and faithful servant.

#SundayBlessing #SundaySchool #ChildrensMinistry

SUNDAY SCHOOL TIP

End every lesson with ONE clear takeaway.

Not three things to remember.
Not five applications.
ONE thing.

"Today, remember this: God loves you no matter what."

That's it. That's what they'll remember at bedtime.

#TeachingTips #SundaySchool #KeepItSimple
